channel.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
channel.description:
Well since ruler is banned here I’ll post some progress and I want your honest opionion and no bs posts(that’s you pwned).
Ruler made me put together a test script in scar to test some fundamentals and then also run it in ibot. First here are the 2 scripts(Same operations just minor syntax changes so thy can run in their respective application: iScar: http://rafb.net/paste/results/kwm5zJ74.html Scar: http://rafb.net/paste/results/EvSJ4B62.html
Here are the numbers I got: iScar (note last collum is millisecs on left 2nd to alst is seconds) [img]http://img240.imageshack.us/img240/9463/iscarrulesgz4.png[/img] TOTAL: 391 milliseconds or .391 seconds
Scar [img]http://img240.imageshack.us/img240/9710/scarblowslj2.png[/img] TOTAL: 3296 milliseconds or 3.296 seconds
I see a clear difference /discuss!

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:15, topic:32319”]I’m not saying pascal is better, far from, but thats no reason to ditch it, and you don’t just switch an entire project to another language, that takes loads of work[/quote]Unless you’re Microsoft.

Read full topic

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

sorry freddy to burst your bubble but kriechsckoy was right, pascal is too archaic of a language to fundamentally keep up with java. if i was you i’d switch srat to c++ and then you could potencially surpasss ibot’s benchmarks with alot of developement.

Read full topic

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Pff, there’ll never be a good scar interpreter in java since no one knows exactly how scar works except for kaitnieks (well i do know my fair share :))
And who knows, maybe kaitnieks will release a new version of SCAR oin the future… since he’s a professional coder it could be good

Read full topic

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Shockingly, it seems that modern optimised Java is much more efficient than an Object Pascal interpreter written in an ancient version of an almost-obsolete language (my CS prof keeps referring to it as ‘legacy’)

That said, iBot is an impressive project. Ruler is definitely the most dedicated public developer that I know of, and SCAR is long overdue for a major revamp anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Funny dat lewls. Ruler starting laughing at us or watever when we were thinking of doing a scar interpreter.

Meh. Good work. :).

Read full topic

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ruler isn’t banned at all.

I was talking to him last night in the IRC channel giving him the idea that outputing java sourcecode from SCAR scripts would be alot better and faster than interpreting the scripts during runtime, but of course he is pretty stubborn and finally just called me an ass and left, so whatever. :rolleyes:

All in all it looks pretty good though.

Read full topic

item.title: iScar in ibot VS Scar

– im not sure what functions are possible but its in its baby stages who knows
